content.description: This somewhat height-dependent problem starts from a cheatstone or pad stack to reach a high left hand edge. Toe into the smooth face and make cruxy moves to the juggy lip before mantling over.
content.location:
About 10' right of

Bob

on the right side of the northwest face.

content.description:
Grab some high edges and make a long move to a rail. Mantle up and climb easy slab to the top. Perhaps more useful as a downclimb.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Between

Easy Skanking

and

Bob

on the northeast face.

content.description:
Start below a black intrusion with undercut feet  and mantle onto it, finishing up an easy slab.

As an alternative you can start a few feet to the right and follow steep smears up and left until possible to step onto the intrusion, after which easy slab moves lead to the top.
content.location:
Left of

Easy Sailing

on the left side of the south face.

content.description:
Paddle up the tall slab on friction and edges staying left of a vague arete. A little crispy like the other slabs here but it will clean up with more traffic.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Between

Easy Sailing

and

Give Thanks and Praises

on the right side of the south face and left of a vague arete.

content.description:
This easy run-and-jump problem aims for a prominent knob midway up and then continues up the slab above after manteling it.

This problem can also be done static at V2 if you're tall enough to reach the knob, or another variation (V0-) is to climb a few moves up

Give Thanks and Praises

and reach straight right to the knob.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Between

Give Thanks and Praises

and

Easy Skanking

in the center of the east face.

content.description:
Another slab route that passes an large incut flake midway up. Like the other slabs more traffic will help to clean this up.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Between

Mellow Mood

and

Jump Nyabinghi

on the left side of the east face and just right of a vague arete.

content.description:
Climb the vague scoop with slopers for your hands and good but hard to see edges for your feet. Requires balance and good footwork.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Between

Jump Nyabinghi

and

Sun is Shining

on the right side of the east face.

content.description:
Begin beneath the right-hand start to

Rita

and instead of traversing left continue up the slab above to the top.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Between

Rita

and

Mellow Mood

in the center of the south face.

content.description: Make some balancy moves getting into the right-leaning offset seam and finish up and right to a jug at the top of the face.
content.location:
Between

Sun is Shining

and

Ziggy

on the left side of the northwest face.
